intro: Potentilla nifdaghensis, commonly known as the Nifdagh cinquefoil, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the Rosaceae family and is characterized by its shrub-like growth habit. The plant features small, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in summer, typically arranged in clusters. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and have a finely toothed margin. Potentilla nifdaghensis is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky or sandy soils.
